Dialogue: *chirp chirp chirp*
Ah... It's morning.
(This is the first time Father has left me in charge of the shrine. I'm not the best at channeling The Great Kiko, and my only talent is cleaning...)
... I should go to the shrine. Since the festival is soon, more and more people have been coming to get blessings from me.
(I really hope I can live up to their expectations.)
*yaawwwnnnn*
Today was quite tiring. It's still really hard to channel The Great Kiko…
Yip yip! Whaddya mean by that, huh???
AH! Great Kiko! Pardon me, I didn't mean to offend. I merely meant-
Oh relax, little miko. It was a joke!
You need to loosen up a bit. If I didn't like you, I wouldn't even respond to your prayers.
Oh, thats-
A good thing! Right? You *do* think it's a good thing, don't you?
Um. It's a lot of responsibility, but I'll do my best.
Grr. You don't sound happy about it, but I'm a gracious fox, so I'll let it slide.
Anyways, don't you think it's about time you started your patrols around the mountain?
Ah- yes, Great Kiko. I'll get going now!
Hmm? The lanterns aren't lit…
Yip yip! Kiko here!
AH! Oh- you scared me!
Wait, more importantly, if the lanterns are out, then you...
I knew I wanted you as my priest for a reason, heehee.
You're absolutely right! The longer these lanterns are out, the more my power to protect you weakens.
Which means you need to hurry and relight them.
Here, take this soul lantern. I've imbued some of my foxfire into it.
Use WASD to move around to approach the unlit lanterns.
Once you're next to an unlit lantern, use WASD again to light the lantern.
It might be dangerous, though, so if you press SPACE, you will be able to put my soul lantern down and repel any yokai looking to get you.
Are you ready?
No, not rea-
Okay! Go go go!!!!
puzzle 1
Phew. We're safe now.
Yip yip! Good job on relighting all the lanterns. Hmmm, I probably should be a bit more worried about the fact that all of them went out at the same time, but oh well!
That's a tomorrow me problem!
Well, you know how it is. I can't go past the lanterns, so I'll be seeing you later!
Yes, I'll- oh, she's already gone.
What was that sound?
*groaaaannnn*
H-hello? Um, are you okay?
...noooooooooo.....
Hold on a moment! I'll be right there!
*shuffle shuffle*
Help... me....
Can you walk? I'm going to bring you back to the village so we can get you taken care of, okay?
(Luckily the stranger doesn't seem severely injured, just tired and bruised.)
(It's quite late right now. I'd feel bad waking the doctor up, and I think I can treat their injuries myself...)
(Back to my house it is.)
*Next Morning*
(Hmm, if I remember correctly, The Great Kiko mentioned that the lanterns going out at the same time was a problem.)
(I hope Miss Kusanagi wasn't hurt because of whatever put them out yesterday... Miss... Kusanagi?)
Oh no! I totally forgot about Miss Kusanagi!
Huh? I was gonna come and say my thanks for saving me, but it looks like you already forgot about me. How sad~
I'm so sorry!!! Please forgive me!
Whoa- I feel like I should be the one saying sorry, Miss Miko. I've made such a busy young lady care for someone like me.
Busy? Ah! I'm sorry, I have to get going to the shrine now! Please feel free to explore the village while I'm gone.
Heeheehee, it's almost festival time! Can you believe that? I'm going to eat so much tofu.
Thank you for your help today, Great Kiko. I'll be heading out now.
Huh???
The lanterns are all out again?
Yip yip! Hmmmm, I did say this was going to be an issue for tomorrow me, but I really don't know what's going on.
Chiyo, because I can't go past the lanters, I'm going to need you to investigate for me, okay?
Come back with your findings tomorrow. I'm gonna take a nap. *Yawn* Blessings tire me out. Good night!
I will do my- oh she's already gone… of course she is.
That was quick.
Huh? Miss Kusanagi? What are you doing here?? Your injuries-
Were treated by an amazing little miko last night. I felt perfectly fine this morning.
I tried following you up the mountain so I could say thanks, but I got lost on the way ahah.
I almost thought I'd be stranded in the forest for the night until you came by and fixed all the lanterns. It seems I am once again in your debt~
O-oh, yes. About the lanterns... Did you see what turned the them off? I'm worried it's a malicious yokai.
Hm? Probably not. I think I saw a couple of kids playing around these lanterns earlier. They must've broken it somehow.
I see. Um, it's still quite dangerous for you to be out here without The Great Kiko's protection. Please let me take you back to the village.
My savior~
(I brought Miss Kusanagi back to the inn, but I didn't get a chance to investigate the lanterns because I had to keep her safe.)
(Hopefully The Great Kiko will understand.)
*Next Morning*
My humblest apologies, Great Kiko! I was unable to obtain any information regarding the lanterns last night!
Huhhh???? Why!? I mean- Ahem. Yip why?????
There was a young lady. Two nights ago, she got lost in the forest and injured herself while trying to find a way out.
I found her near the lanterns last night after you left and got worried that she would get hurt again.
A human? Hurt near the lanterns? Weird, I didn't feel that at all...
Not only that, why and how was she there? The lanterns aren't anywhere close to visitors' footpaths...
I'm sorry, Great Kiko. I thought that myself, but was unable to bring the question up to Miss Kusanagi.
No more sorries, Chiyo Morimiya. You have been blessed by myself, a powerful zenko.
Hold your head up high and do not apologize for doing your duties. You have nothing to fear.
(Ah... That's right... Even though The Great Kiko likes to laze around and be praised over nothing… she's still the same holy kitsune that has protected our village for decades.)
(You… Great Kiko, you're actually kinda cool when you want to be.)
Chiyo, pay close attention to what I'm abount to tell you... I have a bad feeling about this...
(We talked for a while before I headed back down the mountain, ready to face the unknown enemy.)
Oh, hello Miss Kusanagi. It's good to see you here again.
yada yada confrontation
I knew it was you.
